name: intermittently
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that does not happen regularly or continuously; in a way that stops and starts repeatedly or with periods in between: We've discussed this problem intermittently, but so far we've failed to come up with a solution. Lightning flashed intermittently in an otherwise clear sky. See
intermittent
More examplesFewer examplesWind energy supplies power only intermittently - when the wind blows.The group has met intermittently for several years in an attempt to devise a long-term plan.In the war-torn city, electricity is available only intermittently.
